alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Lower Yampa River Basin; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 01 at 9:57AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Warm temperatures have accelerated the snow melt across the high country of northwest Colorado. This is increasing flows on many tributaries of the Yampa River. This water will move through the main stem of the Yampa mid to late this week. Increased reservoir releases may also add additional flows to rivers. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...The Yampa River Basin of northwest Colorado, including the main stem of the Yampa River and associated tributaries across Routt and Moffat Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM MDT this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High runoff of snowmelt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Lower Yampa River Basin; Upper Yampa River Basin
